column4: so in this case, PD is having a second password that will open a partition / account / whatever that has innocuous files instead of the real files
or several, or one; or not having much that can be subject to statistical attacks to reasonably be expected to be an encrypted area, subject to search
are you talking about the cold boot attack or something else?
not really, key/password compromise is much easier with a human in play; no need for shenanigans ;]
we shall now call that the "hbgary attack"
